name: The Dog and Doublet Inn Sandon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After driving past the Dog and Doublet 1 evening I thought it would be nice to revisit during the week.
reviews.title: Busy Wednesday night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked earlier that particular day just in case it was busy and glad I did. The restaurant was full which is always good and added the ambiance of the establishment.
reviews.title: "Outstanding"

reviews.text: Although busy, the food came out very quickly and didn’t lack in quality. Our waiter (Oliver) took good care of us and showed impressive knowledgeable not only of the D&D but also the other establishment’s in the group, which we will be trying out in the near future.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more!
Fabulous
reviews.text: We booked the special deal of afternoon tea,dinner,bed&breakfast ,all for £49 per person. From the moment of arrival,we felt "special",such was the welcome and service.Our room was immaculate,with everything we needed.Afternoon tea was "straight from the Dorchester" with beautiful finger sandwiches in a variety of fillings,scones with tiptree strawberry jam and fresh cream and a lovely selection of cakes.As we didn't want to spoil our appetite for dinner,we reluctantly left the cakes,which were immediately then offered us to take home in the morning,being kept in their fridge overnight! Dinner was excellent ,albeit from a set menu for the deal.When the staff realised that it was our wedding anniversary and my wife's birthday,they surprised us with the dessert served on platters inscribed in icing sugar saying" Happy Anniversary" on mine and "Happy Birthday" on my wife's. Now that is special! Breakfast was first class with service to match.All in all,a totally delightful experience.The staff without exception were a total credit to the company.We are looking forward to our next visit!

Had a lovely evening for my daughters 18th. Excellent service and lovely food! Beautiful decor with a relaxed environment. Thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Would definitely recommend The Dog and Doublet.
reviews.title: Business trip

reviews.text: After sorting out a table due to wrong date entered by them our evening kicked off eating in the pub area rather than the bistro which suited us as it was private and more relaxed and out of the way (complementary drinks for the miss booking would of been nice but never happened). Well appetisers of olives and chippolattas were good and starters of mint pea soup and sea food salad were excellent! Mains of duck breast were excellent the best duck I've tried anywhere and sea food linguine was good although a little on the spicy side. What topped it of was the deserts of Creme brûlée and the chocolate torte which were both excellent and the Italian liqueur coffee. With out those I'd give it 7/10 but with them 8.5/10. The staff were polite welcoming and helpful they did a very good job and will deffo be back in December.
reviews.title: Fabolicous

reviews.text: Having stayed at this place for two nights recently with my family, we were disappointed with the service at breakfast and the room we had was not cleaned to a reasonable standard.
reviews.title: Service slow,rooms need cleaning better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was limited to one croissant per person (when we asked for more we were told no we've run out and the selection of jams was very limited) We also asked for two hot chocolates for our children and we had to wait 40 minutes for them to boil some water apparently (not even made with milk)
reviews.title: A beautifully refurbished Pub/Restaurant.

reviews.text: Our bedroom was clean and tidy , but under our bed I found six hair pins covered in dust, so when was it last cleaned under the bed ??
reviews.title: Good service, pleasant food in lovely spot

reviews.text: Overall the price per night was not equal to what other places offer.
reviews.title: I felt really cheated
Lovely place to stay
reviews.text: Stayed for one one night and to be honest I couldn't really fault the stay at all..

The whole place looks like it has recently been refurbished to a Very good standard. The bedroom was by nice although on the small side but that s a very minor issue . The food is really good and I can't fault the evening meal or the breakfast that I had.
reviews.title: Good local pub/restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would have no hesitation in recommending this Inn to family and friends and if I am ever in the area again I will be staying there. Get it booked !!
reviews.title: Good nights stop over
Great Staffs
reviews.text: In an area devoid of decent pubs serving decent food this pub/restaurant/hotel along with the other outlets run by the Lewis Partnership is a 'must go to' if you want to havwe a decent meal out in the Stafford area. Good value and good food,Helpful staff. Lovely setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean room, with a teddy on the bed that you can buy if you want!!!! Staff very friendly and the breakfast was fantastic, well worth the money, would def stay there again if in the area. The only slight down side was a rather nasty smell in the carpark from the septic tank.
reviews.title: Lovely place
Great value sandwiches!
reviews.text: My son nd I popped in for lunch. I love the decor and comfortable country atmosphere in here. I had a club sandwich and my son the staffordshire burger with added bacon and cheese!! Yum! Large portions, fresh, quality ingredients, very well cooked and presented. Excellent value for money sandwich menu btw. Thank you d n d!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.s. restaurant loos very clean but touch sensitive taps i struggled with!!!
reviews.title: A fortuitous chance booking

reviews.text: On a return trip to Scotland we decided to split our journey and were lucky enough to stumble upon The Dog and Doublet. Beautiful building, fantastic modern room and if things couldn't get better it was steak night! Staff were very attentive and we felt it was great value for money, would throughly recommend.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed
A Great Restaurant for a night out
reviews.text: Friendly Staff...We had the dearest item on the Menu Rib Eye Steak x 2 and they arrived cold! When the waitress came back to see if our meals were ok we said no she then came back and offered us a free dessert..
Breakfast on the Saturday well not as l would have expected..Poached Eggs cold my husband had to go to the kitchen as no staff around!
reviews.title: Excellent value breakfast
